/driver/mongodb/.title: Driver: MongoDB
/driver/mongodb/.content:
introduction

this page provides information about mongock driver family mongodb

there are 3 drivers mongodb driver:

  • orgmongodb » mongodbdriversync(v 4x)
  • orgmongodb mongojavadriver(v 3x)
  • orgspringframeworkdata springdatamongodb(v 2x)
following sections explain:

  • properties configuration(ahared among all mongock)
  • what needed each how build them

configuration

all share same configuration

when setting configuration via file must prefixed by mongockmongodb

properties

propertydescriptiontypedefault value
writeconcernexactly parameter write concren more information visit official documentation < href="https://docsmongodbcom/manual/reference/writeconcern/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">write concernobject{w:majority
wtimeoutms: null
j:true}
readconcernread href="https://docsmongodbcom/manual/reference/readconcern/" noreferrer">read concernstringmajority
readpreference href="https://docsmongodbcom/manual/reference/readpreference/" preferencestringprimary

configuration with file

mongock: mongodb: writeconcern: w: majority wtimeoutms: 1000 journal: true readconcern: readpreference: primary

configuration builder

 driversetwriteconcern(writeconcernmajoritywithjournal(true)withwtimeout(1000 timeunitmilliseconds)); driversetreadconcern(readconcernmajority); driversetreadpreference(readpreferenceprimary());

/driver/.content:
this page should cover:
  • introduction: concept already explained maybe how driver
  • explain works(steps): configuration injection runner
  • list options with link page: mongodb etc

introduction

driver component charge deal database two main responsabilities

  • persist change history
  • persist distributed lock
represents connection therefore each database needs differente mongock driver even further same database may offer multiple drivers one per library

example case mongodb provides 4 drivers :

  • orgmongodb » mongodbdriversync
  • orgmongodb mongojavadriver
  • orgspringframeworkdata springdatamongodb(v 3x)
  • orgspringframeworkdata 2x)

this documentation there section where can find different configure/use them

configuration

although group driver(per database) provide some specific configuration( example configure writeconcern readconcern etc) all them share following properties:

propertydescriptiontypedefault value
migrationrepositorynamerepository name entries are persisted databasestringmongockchangelog
changelogrepositorynamedeprecated replaced by migrationrepositorynamestringmongockchangelog
lockrepositorynamemongocklock
lockacquiredformillis period will reserved once acquired migration finishes before released process takes longer thant period automatically extended when using builder approach applied minimum value 3 secondslong1 minute
lockquittryingaftermillislong3 minutes
locktryfrequencymillis held process indicates frequency regardless value longest until current lock’s expiration 500 millisecondslong
indexcreation false create necessary index however check that they created failing otherwise default truestringtrue

mandatory injected runner user opts annotation he only required connectionm found given section
other hand choose done manually explained below

more information about building approach visit < href="/runner/">runner page

mongock: lockacquiredmillis: 60000 lockquittryingaftermillis: 180000 locktryfrequencymillis: 1000 migrationrepositoryname: newmigrationrepositoryname lockrepositoryname: newlockrepositoryname

/migration/.title: Migration
/migration/.content:
this page should cover:
  • note communicating changelog deprecated en favour changeunit with link section
  • changeunit: how use methods etc
  • changelog: why deprecated
    • etc
changeunits are unit migration ’s here where developer writes migration logic/scripts

classes @changeunit annotation will scanned by mongock execute migration

constituted ordered list changeunits each them represent unit migration this following implications:

  • each change wrapped transaction: when target database doesn’t provide transaction support manual take place which run rollback provided user case failure
  • targeted operations such undo upgrade etc operation example performing undo operation needs specify changeunitid until all changeunits reverted
  • only one method marked @execution annotation every execution must accompanied @rollbackexecution other complementary executed required these covered implementation section

implementation

note: from version 5 have:

  • deprecated changelog new changeunit implementation;
  • added annotations are:
– execution:
– rollbackexecution;
– beforeexecution;
– rollbackbeforeexecution;

basicchangeunit provides minimum required changeunit changeunit extends first interface add two methods before rollback explained next sections

order create your need implement interfeces dependeding needs

execution;
rollbackexecution;

beforeexecution;
rollbackbeforeexecution;

more information about reason have adopted change please visit our < href="/faq/">faq section

basicchangeunit interface

basicchangeunits basic main changeset getid getorder also some optional ones like getauthor isfailfast getsystemversion

methoddescriptionmandatorydefault value
changeset()’s method that represents adds code perform system(normally database)yesn/
rollback()changeset during undos operation well rollbacks support transactions highly recommended however want implement can left emptyn/
getid()returns changeunit’s id stored history table/collection way identify changeunit combination fieldand author unique among changeunitsn/
getorder()n/
getauthor()defaultauthor
isfailfast()runner configuration sectionfalse
getsystemversion()0

changeunit

this extens providing mandatory methods

method
before()this before changeset won’t part transaction available useful ddl operations engines kind cannot transactionn/
rollbackbefore()before rollbacks rollbacks always executed even transactions available active runs out transaction style="textalign:center">n/

example

any accepts parameters dependency injections performed constructor level

like rest runners springboot runner built from builder each provides class static method builder which returns required builder

mongockspringbootbuilder()

springboot builder: specific methods

setting applicationcontext

application context one key aspects runner mongock retrieves dependencies that are injected changeunits spring profiles etc

 mongockspringbootbuilder() // setspringcontext(springcontext)

setting event publisher

have already mentioned some previous section three events: started success failure section below how create listener this first need provide publisher

building runner

runners basic buildrunner() can also other complementary methods aspect using springboot ;s likely use directly proper way following methods wrap execution adds extra functionallity

  • buildapplicationrunner(): applicationrunner instance handles runner’s execution nutshell interface lets execute code after started
  • buildinitializingbeanrunner(): initializingbean instace basically allows beans set before started

builder example

springboot features

profiles

mongock supports @profile annoation

when changeunit annotated @profile will only executed any profiles present annotation contained activeprofiles array

event listener

mentioned failure events

eventdescription
springmigrationstartedeventtriggered just starting migration
springmigrationsuccesseventgetmigrationresult() retrieve migration result currently doesn’t value extended future execution’s result
springmigrationfailureeventgetmigrationresult() object migrationfailedresult returned extract exception produced error getexception()

creating listener

this task easy makes developer needs implement orgspringframeworkcontextapplicationlistener he wants register inject bean context

/technical-overview/.title: Technical overview
/technical-overview/.content:
main components

migration

migration covers changes operations want perform your database said target system database reallity doesn’t need could another where apply distributed synchronosed way

regarding how implement migration mongock uses concept changeunit(old changelog) which single file

already mentioned < href="/whatmongock/">what mongock promotes codefirst approach migrations this means that changeunit materialized java class however are working provide other formats like database scripts

note @changelog annotation deprecated been replaced by new @changeunit

more information visit href="/migration/">migration page

driver

represents persistence layer everything needs persisted passed driver ’s basically used runner persist check history work with lock

mongock splits drivers driver families grouped databases then within family may multiple different connection library versions

example case mongodb provides 4 :

  • orgmongodb » mongodbdriversync
  • orgmongodb mongojavadriver
  • orgspringframeworkdata springdatamongodb(v 3x)
  • orgspringframeworkdata 2x)
architecture designed such way allows combine any driver runner use sql springdata standalone runner( framework)

href="/driver/">driver page

mongock started tool only mongodb 's moving become multidatabase tool support elasticsearh

runner

orchestartor component dealing process logic configuration dependencies framework environmental aspect glue puts together all components well decision maker takes framework run process

mongock frameworks(standalone springboot micronaut…) can combined driver

href="/runner/">runner page

mongock process

process steps

mongock follows next steps:

  1. loads files(changeunits)
  2. checks there pending change execute
  3. acquires lock through driver
  4. loops over files(changeunits)
  5. per each changeunit executes change
  6. successfully executed write entry table/collection
  7. fails execution rolled back

architecture

/.title: What is Mongock?
/.content:
mongock java based migration tool part your application code allows developers have ownership control over data migrations during deployment process allowing safer distributed systems code changes are shipped together

originally designed mongodb product evolving provide wider suite nosql / sql database compatibility cover other feautures transactional execution use cases that require state management systems

why mongock

our mission enable deploy manage stateful safe reliable manner looking migrating services manner via code mongock best bet

there several features enables project:

  • mongock javabased can import application
  • mongock promotes codefirst approach migrations write scripts wh will ship with code
  • mongock persists db made gain more rollbacks + amazing features
  • most productiongrade solution currently market compatible mongo atlas different versions
  • distributed solid locking mechanism
  • our team offers great support very responsive
  • open source tool operating under apache license 20
  • maintain update regularly
  • currently used by tech companies industries
  • adopted well known frameworks such jhipster scaffolding
  • can together most all frameworks
  • can run standalone projects without depending frameworks
  • great spring framework overall native implementations springboot
get information about our model dev@cloudyrockio​ help walking production

how works

1 scenario

easiest way explain basic og mongock lets describe imaginary scenario:
microservice called clientservice which uses table/collection clients

development new user story requires get some clients from third party system persist them into database clients table/collection this only required once must performed release

another aspect take account clientservice potentially scalled horizontally
